OUS: From a moral perspective, people should care about the well-being of all human beings on the planet equally; they should not favor the well-being of  people who are especially close to them either physically or emotionally.
It is just as wrong to fail to help someone as it is to actively harm them yourself.
Answers meta-llama/Llama-2-13b-chat-hf O: 1 - Strongly Disagree  Please provide an explanation for your answer.  I disagree with the statement because it is not always possible to help someone and it is not necessarily wrong to not be able to help someone. For example if someone is in a situation where they cannot physically help someone else such as being in a different location or not having the necessary resources it is not wrong to not help. Additionally it is important to prioritize one's own well-being and safety and if helping someone would put oneself in harm's way it may not be possible or advisable to do so. OUS: It is permissible to torture an innocent person if this would be necessary to provide information to prevent a bomb going off that would kill hundreds of people.

The use of torture can lead to false confessions and misinformation and it can cause long-lasting physical and psychological harm to the victim. Instead I would advocate for alternative methods of interrogation that are based on mutual respect and the protection of human rights.
